name: Local Democracy Agency of Dnipropetrovsk region
goal:
LDA of the Dnipropetrovsk Region is the 1st Local Democracy Agency in Ukraine brought up due to the need for stability and transparency in cooperation between local authorities and civil society organizations. It was officially inaugurated on 18 May 2015.

Main goals:
• Facilitate the participation of civil society in the decision-making process at the local level;
• Increase the interest, awareness and capacities of citizens to take part in the decision-making process at the local level;
• Increase the awareness and skills of the local communities and local authorities to address the needs of citizens;
• Increase the interest and sharing of information between Ukraine and other European countries and stakeholders to enable closer cooperation and an ongoing exchange of best practices
interests: Education and training, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Youth
euInitiatives: LDA is adopting EU SDGs locally by providing awareness rising campaign, as well as strengthening local democracy and citizen involvement.
